intro: Calais aphantocarpha, commonly known as the slender false mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces small, pale pink or white flowers. Its leaves are ovate with a slightly hairy texture, and it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. Calais aphantocarpha is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
